long: Meaning: "who?" (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) "whoever"; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix.  Usage: any (man), × he, × him,   O that! what, which, who(-m, -se, -soever),   would to God.  Source: an interrogative pronoun of persons, as "H4100" is of things,
